title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The minimal supporting computation that must be shown is 1 8−( −8 ) . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3996@ Because the answer does not need to be simplified, this answer would earn the point. (Any simplification must be correct.)

Just g ( 8 )−g ( −8 ) 8−( −8 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4393@ will not earn the point; g must be evaluated at both x=8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGioaaaa@35F7@ and x=−8. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaeyOeI0IaaGioaiaac6caaaa@3796@

An answer of 1 16 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIXaGaaGOnaaaaaaa@3578@ with no supporting work does not earn the point.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The point is earned for −1 ( −4 ) 2 −4 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B6C@ which does not need to be simplified. If this answer is simplified, it must be done correctly.

An answer of just − 1 12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsisldaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIXaGaaGOmaaaaaaa@3661@ does not earn the point because it does not show the computations that led to this answer.

Just g ( − 4 ) 12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BFB@ does not earn the point; the value of g ( − 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A74@ must be found.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned only for a k derivative of a ⋅ g ( 3−2x )+b ⋅ x ⋅  g ′  ( 3−2x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@56F6@ where a and b are nonzero constants.

Second point:

This point is earned only for seeing −2 ⋅  g ′  ( 3−2x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41D4@ as part of one term in the k derivative (with or without the factor of x).

These two points can be earned in either order or simultaneously.

Third point:

This point is earned only for the correct answer, in the presence of correct supporting work.

g ( −5 )−8 ⋅  g ′  ( −5 )=− 4−8 ⋅ 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5215@ would be the minimal computations that must be shown in order to earn all three points in this part.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned only for the single correct interval ( 0,  4 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AAB@

The interval may be written as an open, closed, or half-open/closed interval.

Second point:

The connection h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbauaacqGH9aqpcaWGNbaaaa@361D@ or h ″ = g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbayaacqGH9aqpce WGNbGbauaaaaa@362B@ must be explicitly made. One of these connections may have been made in an earlier part of the problem. We will look for it somewhere in parts (a), (b), (c), and (d). Once this connection has been made, we will carry it to all subsequent parts of the problem.

The justification must include linking h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbauaacqGH9aqpcaWGNbaaaa@361D@ is positive to increasing, and h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbauaacqGH9aqpcaWGNbaaaa@361D@ is increasing or h ″ = g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbayaacqGH9aqpce WGNbGbauaaaaa@362B@ is positive to concave up.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned for identifying x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@35EF@ as a point of interest. This might be done by stating that x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@35EF@ is a critical point, or claiming that h ′  ( 0 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39BF@ or g ( 0 )=0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A64@

Second point:

This point is earned for correctly calculating the value of h ( −8 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@399A@

Third point:

This point is earned for correctly calculating the value of h ( 8 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38AD@

Fourth point:

This point is earned for identifying 8π MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI4aGaeqiWdahaaa@35B1@ as the largest of the three evaluated values, with an explanation of why these values were considered (e.g., “the maximum will occur at a critical point or endpoint”).

This point cannot be earned if the student does not declare the largest evaluation as the maximum.

The point cannot be earned for reporting only the location of the maximum.

This point cannot be earned if h is simply evaluated at a list of x-values that are not (incorrectly) declared to be critical points (e.g., x=− 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaeyOeI0IaaGjcVlaaiAdaaaa@3873@ or x=− 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaeyOeI0IaaGjcVlaaisdaaaa@3871@ ).

This point can be earned using an accumulation of areas argument. But in this case, the response must still indicate that the accumulated area at x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@35EF@ is 0 in order to earn the point.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

This point is for finding the value of 4. No supporting work is required.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned for a response of 24r 1−r . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3904@

A response may jump to an equating of 4 with the sum: 24r=4( 1−r ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B8F@ or 6r=1−r. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3940@ Either of these would earn the first point.

Second point:

The second point is for establishing that r= 1 7 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@376D@

A response may have used an incorrectly computed value of h ′  ( 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbauaacaaMi8+aae WaaeaacaaI0aaacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3805@ from part (f). Such a response is eligible for both points in this part. In this case, the value of r that is reported as an answer must be correct for the value of h ′  ( 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3803@ being used.

An answer of h ′  ( 4 )=a>−12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D5B@ in part (f) is consistent with r= a 24+a . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A19@

An answer of h ′  ( 4 )=a≤−12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E08@ in part (f) is consistent with no solution since |  r  |>1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CE2@

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned for the assertion that h is both differentiable and continuous.

There is no need to repeat the interval in question. If the interval is repeated, it does not matter whether the interval is open or closed.

Second point:

This point is earned only if the response discusses the continuity of h answers “yes,” and appeals to the MVT or restates the conclusion of the theorem in this situation.

A response of “h is differentiable and continuous, so there is a value in this interval where the average rate of change is equal to the slope of the secant line” would earn both points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.

The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned for realizing that the given integral measures the length of the arc of g on the interval [ 0,  8 ]. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B18@ This could be accomplished by:

· discussing the circumference of some portion of a circle,

· stating that the integral gives the length of the curve g from 0 to 8, or

· reporting that “the semicircle has length 4π. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI0aGaeqiWdaNaaiOlaaaa@365F@ ”

Second point:

This point is earned when the circumference of the semicircle is computed as 4π. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI0aGaeqiWdaNaaiOlaaaa@365F@
